intro: Reseda massae, commonly known as yellow rattle, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, yellow flowers and distinctive seed pods. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Reseda massae is known for its ecological importance in supporting biodiversity within its native ecosystems.
